sentences.sContent: Mark is a smart and sophisticated young man.
sentences.sCn: 马克是一个聪明老成的年轻人。

sentences.sContent: Honeybees use one of the most sophisticated communication systems of any insect.
sentences.sCn: 蜜蜂所使用的交流系统是昆虫中最复杂的之一。

sentences.sContent: ...LOL has evolved into something much subtler and sophisticated and is used even when nothing is remotely amusing...
...But even the most sophisticated digital literacy skills won't help students and workers navigate the world if they don't have a broad base of knowledge about how the world actually operates...
...Ongoing research tracking prospective 2012 students suggests that they are not only becoming more sophisticated in thinking about what they want from a university...
...Others have promised use of sophisticated equipment that turned out to be broken or unavailable...
...using innovative tools to identify kids with sophisticated verbal skills...
...but because of the sophisticated voice services that can be exploited by the remote worker—facilities such as voicemail and call forwarding...

synos.tran: 复杂的；精致的；久经世故的；富有经验的
使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式）

remMethod.val: sophist(诡辩家) ＋ icated → 诡辩家都是老于世故的 → 老于世故的

words.tran: 二年级的；二年级学生的
大学二年级生；（美）有二年经验的人
复杂；诡辩；老于世故；有教养
弄复杂；使变得世故；曲解

trans.tranOther: Someone who is sophisticated is comfortable in social situations and knows about culture, fashion, and other matters that are considered socially important.
